abstract_summ: Thorough experiments present the differences between existing centralities and Node Conductance, its outstanding ability of detecting influential nodes on both static and dynamic network, and its superior efficiency compared with other global centralities.This measure applied for temporal networks intends to favor nodes that vary their neighbourhood highly and, thanks to that, are good spreaders for certain influence models.Moreover, with the help of node embedding techniques, Node Conductance is able to be approximately calculated on big networks effectively and efficiently.In this work, we explore whether existing network growth models can realize the diversity in citation growth exhibited by individual papers – a new node-centric property observed recently in citation networks across multiple domains of research.Several network growth models have been proposed in the literature that attempt to incorporate properties of citation networks.
title_summ: Based Approach for Effective Sequential Initialization of Information Spreading Processes Within Complex NetworksEntropy-Based Measure for Influence Maximization in Temporal NetworksLink Prediction by Analyzing Temporal Behavior of VerticesInvestigating Key Factors for Social Network Evolution and Opinion Dynamics in an Agent-Based SimulationAn Evaluation Algorithm of the Importance of Network NodeBased on Community InfluenceAdaptive Influence Maximization: If Influential Node Unwilling to Be the SeedLarge-scale estimation of random graph models with local dependenceModeling Citation Trajectories of Scientific PapersNode Conductance: A Scalable Node Centrality Measure on Big NetworksMaximalInfluence Maximization in NetworksBelief Functions for the Importance Assessment in Multiplex NetworksIdentifying Influential Spreaders On a Weighted Network Using HookeRankMethodA Dynamic Vote-Rank
title_abstract_phrases: This measure applied for temporal networks intends to favor nodes that vary their neighbourhood highly and, thanks to that, are good spreaders for certain influence models.In this work, we explore whether existing network growth models can realize the diversity in citation growth exhibited by individual papers – a new node-centric property observed recently in citation networks across multiple domains of research.Thorough experiments present the differences between existing centralities and Node Conductance, its outstanding ability of detecting influential nodes on both static and dynamic network, and its superior efficiency compared with other global centralities.Many real-world networks like Road Network, Email Networks are weighted networks.An Evaluation Algorithm of the Importance of Network Node Based on Community InfluenceIdentifying nodes in social networks that have great influence on information dissemination is of great significance for monitoring and guiding information dissemination.
